basics.name: Ufuk Cetiner
basics.label: Aeronautical Engineering Student
basics.summary: I’m an Aeronautical Engineering student at Imperial College London with a passion for hands-on design and creative problem-solving. Whether it’s designing systems that fly, float, or fold, I enjoy turning ideas into functional prototypes.

projects.name: Small Scale Wind Turbine Blade Design
projects.summary: Designed, analyzed, and manufactured small-scale wind turbine blades by integrating aerodynamic theory with structural optimization. The project involved iterative testing, simulation, and hands-on prototyping.

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.
